title: Standalone ATS-friendly Resume Generator wizard (new tool route)

requirements.summary: Add a dedicated ATS Resume Generator route/page that implements a mobile-friendly step-by-step wizard covering all required resume sections with basic validation and no login.
acceptanceCriteria: A new dedicated page/route exists for the ATS Resume Generator tool and renders without runtime errors.
The tool UI is a step-by-step wizard with clear navigation (e.g., Next/Back) and does not require login.
Wizard steps include inputs for: Contact, Summary, Skills, Experience, Education, Certifications, Projects, and Keyword suggestions.
All inputs have basic validation and clear labels; the page remains mobile-friendly and consistent with the existing design system (Tailwind + shadcn).

file_operations.description: Create the ATS Resume Generator wizard UI as a step-by-step flow (Contact, Summary, Skills, Experience, Education, Certifications, Projects, Keywords) with local state, basic per-step validation, and Next/Back navigation. Use shadcn-ui building blocks (e.g., Card, Button, Input, Textarea, Separator, Badge/Alert where applicable) composed via existing components (do not edit any files under frontend/src/components/ui). Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Define TypeScript types/interfaces for the wizard data model (contact details, skills, experiences with action verbs + metrics prompts, education, certifications, projects, and keyword suggestion inputs/outputs) to keep the wizard implementation maintainable.

Add lightweight synchronous validation helpers for required fields and common formatting checks (e.g., email/phone presence, required titles/companies/dates, non-empty arrays) used by the wizard to show clear inline errors.

Create a dedicated tool page that renders the wizard in the existing ToolPageLayout pattern (title, description, canonicalPath, content/faqs). Use shadcn-ui composition for any page-level containers if needed. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Add SEO content + FAQs arrays for the ATS Resume Generator page (student-focused, India-relevant, ATS-friendly guidance). Keep content plain and consistent with existing SEO content modules.

requirements.summary: Generate an ATS-friendly single-column plain-text resume preview from wizard inputs with one-click copy-to-clipboard and .txt download (no backend calls).
acceptanceCriteria: The generated resume output is plain, ATS-friendly text (no tables, no multi-column formatting) and updates based on the wizard inputs.
A "Copy" action copies the full resume text to clipboard using the existing clipboard utility pattern.
A "Download" action downloads a .txt file containing the full resume text.
Export actions work in modern browsers and do not require any backend calls.

file_operations.description: Implement pure functions that transform wizard inputs into a single-column ATS-friendly plain-text resume string (section headings, bullet formatting, consistent spacing). Include local-only keyword suggestion heuristics derived from provided skills/experience/project text (no network calls).

Wire live resume preview generation using atsResumeTextGenerator and render a plain-text preview panel. Add export actions: Copy uses frontend/src/lib/clipboard.ts copyToClipboard; Download creates a Blob and triggers a .txt file download with a sensible filename. Use shadcn-ui Button and any feedback patterns (e.g., toast/alert) via existing components/utilities. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

If needed for the new tool, extend robustness/UX while preserving the existing clipboard utility pattern (e.g., ensure errors propagate cleanly so the UI can show a failure message). Keep it compatible with modern browsers and fallback behavior.

requirements.summary: Register the new ATS Resume Generator route and integrate it into existing SEO metadata and sitemap.xml.
acceptanceCriteria: The new ATS Resume Generator route is registered in frontend/src/routes/Router.tsx using the same lazy-loading/Suspense approach as other tool pages.
The new route has an SEO metadata entry in frontend/src/seo/seoRoutes.ts so HeadTags sets title/meta/canonical correctly.
frontend/public/sitemap.xml includes the new ATS Resume Generator URL with appropriate changefreq/priority consistent with other tool routes.
Navigating directly to the new URL loads the page and shows correct SEO title/description in the document head.

file_operations.description: Add a new lazy-loaded tool page import for AtsResumeGeneratorPage and register a dedicated route path for the ATS Resume Generator using the same createRoute pattern as existing tool pages (ensuring it participates in existing Suspense loading).
Add SEO metadata entry for the ATS Resume Generator route (title, description, keywords, canonicalPath) consistent with other tool routes and targeted to engineering students in India.
Insert a new <url> entry for the ATS Resume Generator route with changefreq/priority aligned to other tool routes in the sitemap.

requirements.summary: Add a new tool card entry in the Resume & Placement Help section that navigates to the dedicated ATS Resume Generator page while leaving existing four tool cards and modal behavior unchanged.
acceptanceCriteria: The Resume & Placement Help section shows an additional tool card for the ATS Resume Generator.
Clicking the ATS Resume Generator card navigates to the dedicated ATS Resume Generator route (full page).
The existing four tools (Resume Bullet Generator, Internship Email Template, Interview Prep Checklist, LinkedIn Profile Checklist) continue to open in the current modal behavior unchanged.
The new card matches the existing styling and responsive grid behavior.

file_operations.description: Add a fifth tool card styled identically to existing cards that navigates (full page) to the ATS Resume Generator route using TanStack Router navigation. Keep the existing tools array + dialog/modal openTool behavior unchanged for the original four cards. Use existing shadcn-ui Card styling already present; do not edit any files under frontend/src/components/ui. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
